title: Erdős Problem #152: Isolated Elements in Sidon Sumsets
description: For large finite Sidon sets A, are there arbitrarily many isolated elements a ∈ A+A with a±1 ∉ A+A? Conjectured ≫ |A|² such elements. OPEN.

overview.historicalContext: Erdős, Sárközy, and Sós (1994) studied the structure of sumsets A + A when A is a Sidon set. They asked whether large Sidon sets always produce many isolated elements in A + A — elements with no neighbors in the sumset. The stronger form conjectures ≫ |A|² such elements.
overview.problemStatement: For any M ≥ 1, if A ⊂ ℕ is a sufficiently large finite Sidon set, do there exist at least M elements a ∈ A + A such that a - 1, a + 1 ∉ A + A?
overview.proofStrategy: We define IsSidonFinset (distinct pairwise sums), sumsetFinset (A + A), IsIsolated and isolatedCount. ErdosProblem152 states the weak version (unbounded count). ErdosProblem152Strong states the ≫ |A|² version. Sumset size and range bounds for Sidon sets are axiomatized. The infinite version is also stated.
keyInsights: Sidon sets have |A + A| = n(n+1)/2, nearly half of all possible sums
The sumset fits in an interval of length ≤ 2·max A, creating many gaps
Isolated elements are those with no sumset neighbors, measuring sparsity
The conjectured ≫ |A|² count says a positive fraction of the sumset is isolated

sections.title: Sidon Sets and Sumsets
sections.summary: Defines IsSidonFinset (distinct pairwise sums) and sumsetFinset (A + A).

sections.title: Isolated Elements
sections.summary: Defines IsIsolated (no sumset neighbors) and isolatedCount.

sections.title: The Conjecture
sections.summary: States ErdosProblem152: isolatedCount → ∞ as |A| → ∞ over Sidon sets.

sections.title: The Stronger Conjecture
sections.summary: ErdosProblem152Strong: isolatedCount ≥ c·|A|² for some c > 0.

sections.title: Sumset Size for Sidon Sets
sections.summary: |A + A| = n(n+1)/2 and Sidon sets need max element ≥ n² - n + 1.

sections.title: Related Results
sections.summary: Pigeonhole gap existence and the infinite Sidon set version.

conclusion.summary: Erdős Problem 152 asks whether large Sidon sets always produce many isolated elements in their sumsets. The weak version (unbounded count) and strong version (≫ |A|²) are both open.
conclusion.implications: Understanding the gap structure of Sidon sumsets connects to additive combinatorics and the inverse sumset problem.
openQuestions: Does isolatedCount → ∞ for large Sidon sets?
Is isolatedCount ≥ c·|A|² for some absolute constant c?
Does the analogous result hold for infinite Sidon sets?
